action.action-desc: Mr. Collins of New York (for himself and Mr. Flores) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to reduce unnecessary emergency room visits under the Medicaid program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Reducing Unnecessary Emergency Room Visits under Medicaid Act.

section.header: State option to impose higher cost sharing for nonemergency use of emergency room services

subsection.text: Section 1916 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396o) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)(3), by striking up to twice the nominal amount and inserting up to $25; and
in subsection (b)(3), by striking up to twice the nominal amount and inserting up to $25.

subsection.header: State option for alternative premiums and cost sharing
subsection.text: Section 1916A(e)(2) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396o–1(e)(2)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking twice the amount determined to be nominal under section 1916 and inserting the amount specified in paragraph (3) of subsection (a) or (b) (as applicable) of section 1916 with respect to non-emergency services; and

in subparagraph (B), by striking a nominal amount (as otherwise determined under section 1916) and inserting the amount specified in paragraph (3) of subsection (a) or (b) (as applicable) of section 1916 with respect to non-emergency services.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to items and services furnished on or after October 1, 2017.
